episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about a woman who died of laughter at a drag performance, the invention of the water bed with jelly, a room in the Pentagon for Pokemon battles, and a family surviving a shipwreck with turtle blood enemas. The hosts discuss these topics with humor and delve into related anecdotes and trivia.

facts.fact: In 1782, a woman found a drag performance so hilarious that she literally died of laughter.
The first modern water bed was filled with jelly rather than water.
There used to be a room in the Pentagon where employees met specifically to have Pokemon battles.
In 1972, a family who had survived a shipwreck kept themselves alive by giving each other turtle blood enemas.
